DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of erythrocyte alloantibodies present.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Cell specialized for oxygen transport, having a high concentration of hemoglobin in the cytoplasm and little else; biconcave, anucleate discs, 7nm diameter in mammals._An antibody that is produced following exposure to non-self antigens from other members of the same species._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cell specialized for oxygen transport, having a high concentration of hemoglobin in the cytoplasm and little else; biconcave, anucleate discs, 7nm diameter in mammals.:An antibody that is produced following exposure to non-self antigens from other members of the same species.

Concepts.definition: A blood cell specialized for oxygen transport, having a high concentration of hemoglobin in the cytoplasm. They are biconcave, anucleate discs, with a 6-8um diameter in humans.
An antibody that is produced following exposure to non-self antigens from other members of the same species.
